Welcome to Hal 9000’s documentation!¶

Hal 9000 bot¶

Discord bot Starts the discord bot, and add listeners to commends

bot.on_message(message)¶

Filters message before triggering commands

Parameters

message – received message from discord

Returns

bot.on_ready()¶

Listener function doing things when bot is connected

Returns

Skroutz Scrapping library¶

Library for web-scrapping and parsing skroutz.com

skroutz_scrapper.deep_dive(url: str, args: dict = {}) → str¶

Returns actual url, of search - tries to navigate to tech. category if multiple results

Parameters

  • url – url

  • args – optional url parameters (must be formatted)

Returns

returns the actual url

skroutz_scrapper.get_product_page(url: str, max_num_of_res: int = 5, args: dict = {}) -> (<class 'list'>, <class 'str'>)¶

Finds product prices from product url, search query, or search result

Parameters

  • url – the actual url (product, search, or search result)

  • max_num_of_res – =5max number of results (when available)

  • args – optional url parameters

Returns

list of lists with price and link, error message

skroutz_scrapper.price_to_float(s: str) → float¶

Converts a string with format ‘n.nnn,nn €’ to float

Parameters

s – the price

Returns

return price in float

Common¶

This module contains various functions used across the project.

common.generate_embed(title: str = '', description: str = 'rand_quote', add_images: bool = True)¶

Generator for prototype discord embed message

Parameters

  • title – Embed title

  • description – Embed discription

  • add_images – option to include thumbnail image

Returns

discord.Embed obj

common.is_mention(s: str)¶

Checks if a string is a user mention

Parameters

s – String to check

Returns

returns the userID in case of mention else 0

common.split_mentions(l: list) -> (<class 'list'>, <class 'list'>)¶

Removes mentions from list of strings and returns both as separate lists

Parameters

l – list of strings

Returns

(arguments, mentions)

Connection with Django Backend¶

This module is responsible for connecting the bot to the django back-end database

db_access.black_list_user(user_id, reason='')¶

Adds a user to Blacklist :param user_id: Discord ID :param reason: :return:

db_access.get_admins()¶
Returns

admins ID list

db_access.get_allowed_channels()¶

Gets allowed channel form Django DB :return: list of strings containing channels discord id

db_access.get_black_list()¶

returns id of all blacklisted users :return:

db_access.get_builds(price: int) → list¶

Finds builds close to target price (within 10%) :param price: target price :return: list of lists.models.Build objects

db_access.get_monitor(price: int, resolution: str = '', refresh_rate: int = 0)¶

Finds monitors close to given price (within 25% max 42euros) :param price: target price :param resolution: resolution (optional) :param refresh_rate: refresh rate (optional) :return:

db_access.get_peripheral(price: int, type)¶

Finds peripherals close to given price (within 12%) :param price: target price :param type: type of peripheral :return: list of lists.models.Peripheral objects

db_access.helper_fuzzy_match(s)¶

Matches string to list.models.Helper object (80% accuracy) :param s: :return: list.models.Helper object or None

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

update_price(force=False)¶

Updates object price

Parameters

force – forces update all objects (depreciated)y

Returns

Parts¶

class parts.models.AbstractPart(*args, **kwargs)¶
clean()¶

Hook for doing any extra model-wide validation after clean() has been called on every field by self.clean_fields. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field defined by NON_FIELD_ERRORS.

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.
